thread.title: Deal watch: Princess Cruises kicks off fall promotion
thread.title_full: Deal watch: Princess Cruises kicks off fall promotion

title: Deal watch: Princess Cruises kicks off fall promotion
text:
Princess Cruises' newest ship, the 3,560-passenger Regal Princess, sets sail from New York on September 26. Fares are from $1,099. (Photo: Princess Cruises)
2 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Princess Cruises is out with a new promotion that brings on-board credits of up to $300 per cabin with select bookings.
The Sun Drenched Deals offer is available with more than 130 sailings in 2016 to such warm-weather destinations as the Caribbean, Mexican Riviera, California Coast and Hawaiian Islands.
The promotion brings $300 per cabin in credits to passengers booking a balcony cabin, mini-suite or suite on a voyage of 10 days or longer. Passengers booking a balcony cabin, mini-suite or suite on six- to seven-day voyages will get a $150 per cabin credit.
Passengers booking interior and ocean-view cabins will receive a $50 to $100 credit, depending on itinerary length.
USA TODAY
Sign of the times? Next Princess Cruises ship to be called 盛世公主号
Princess also is reducing the deposit needed to hold a cabin during the promotion to $100 per person.
To qualify for the promotion, bookings must be made by 11:59 p.m. PST on Nov. 17. The offer only is available to residents of the United States, Canada, Mexico and Bermuda.
For a deck-by-deck look at Princess' newest ship, the Regal Princess , click through the carousel below.
Princess Cruises' newest ship, the 3,560-passenger Regal Princess, debuted in May 2014 in the Mediterranean. Princess Cruises Fullscreen Built at the Fincantieri shipyard near Trieste, Italy, the 142,714-ton Regal Princess is tied with sister ship Royal Princess as the largest Princess vessel ever. Princess Cruises Fullscreen The Regal Princess' main pool area has a large rectangular pool and a plunge pool surrounded by curving wading areas and two hot tubs. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen There are two hot tubs located to the sides of the Regal Princess' main Fountain Pool. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A close-up of the plunge pool on the Regal Princess' main deck. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Regal Princess' main pool area features a large movie screen that is home to the line's signature Movies Under the Stars program. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Retreat Pool and Bar, on Deck 17 near the front of the vessel, is an adults-only area that is open to passengers at no extra cost. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Retreat Pool area has six private cabanas available at an extra charge. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Retreat Bar is just steps away from the Retreat pool. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Adjacent to the Retreat area is the Sanctuary, Princess' signature extra-charge, adults-only area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Sanctuary includes a shaded seating area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen New on the Regal Princess is the Terrace Pool, which overlooks the back of the ship. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Terrace Pool is located on Deck 17 just above the Horizon buffet. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like the Royal Princess, the Regal Princess has a "SeaWalk" -- a glass-enclosed walkway cantilevered nearly 30 feet off the side of the vessel. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A close-up view of the Regal Princess' SeaWalk, which hangs off the side of the ship 17 decks above the sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Passengers can look down 17 decks through glass flooring at the SeaWalk. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like other Princess ships, the Regal Princess has a grand atrium called the Piazza that serves as a central hub. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen As with the Piazza on the Royal Princess, the Piazza on the Regal Princess is 50% larger than similar spaces on previous Prinecss ships and features natural lighting from curving walls of glass facing the sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Piazza is home to a wine bar, pizzeria and other food and drink outlets spread over three decks, including Ocean Terrace (shown here) -- a seafood bar that first debuted on Royal Princess. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Ocean Terrace offers an array of a la carte seafood items including oyster shooters, fresh sushi and sashimi. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Piazza bar is on the bottom-level of the Piazza. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 7 overlooking the Piazza is Crooners, Princess' signature, 1960s-style martini bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Crooners serves more than 75 types of martinis that are shaken tableside. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Live piano entertainment adds to the Rat Pack-era feel at Crooners. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also overlooking the Atrium is Vines, a wine and tapas bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Vines offers an international mix of small plates including Spanish tapas, Greek mazes, Venetian cachets, Latin American pinches and Caribbean cutters. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also overlooking the Piazza, from Deck 6, is Bellini's, an Italy-inspired cocktail venue that serves sparkling wine cocktails. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located at the base level of the Piazza on Deck 5 is the International Cafe, which serves up espresso drinks (for an extra charge) as well as pastries, panini sandwiches and fresh-baked cookies. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Pastries at the International Cafe are available at no extra charge. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Overlooking the Piazza, the 121-seat Alfredo's Pizzeria serves hand-tossed Neapolitan-style pizza as well as antipasti, soup, salads, baked pastas and desserts Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Pizza is made on site at Alfredo's Pizzeria. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Another Piazza outlet called Gelato serves Italian-style ice cream made by hand on the ship. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen In addition to designer sundaes, creamy fruit smoothies and frosty shakes, Gelato serves sweet crespelles (Italian crepes) and homemade waffle ice cream cones. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Princess Theater, the Regal Princess' main theater, is notable for a design that doesn't have pillars blocking views. It's home to production shows and other nightly entertainment. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen More intimate than the Princess Theater is the Royal Princess' Vista Lounge, which is home to a variety of entertainment nightly from live bands to comedians to illusionists. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Princess Live! is a television studio built with space for a live audience. It'll be used to broadcast on-board shows, cooking demonstrations and other events throughout the day. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Princess Live! Cafe is just outside the Princess Live! studio and offers aperitifs, coffee drinks and more. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The bar at the Princess Live! Cafe. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Regal Princess' Princess Casino, on Deck 6, offers slot machines and table games including blackjack, Texas Hold 'em and roulette. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The table game area of the Princess Casino. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Adjacent to the Princess Casino is the Royal Princess' nightclub, Club 6. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen In addition to a dance floor, Club 6 offers a menu of specialty cocktails and premium spirits. A trolley offers tableside service of shooter cocktails. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The dance floor at Club 6. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Regal Princess has three main dining rooms, including the Concerto on Deck 6, shown here. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like other Princess ships, the Regal Princess has a Tuscan-inspired, extra-charge restaurant called Sabatini's (the current charge is a flat $25 per person for dinner). Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Regal Princess also features one of Princess' signature Crown Grill steak and seafood restaurants. The extra-charge eatery boasts an open, theater-style kitchen. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located adjacent to the Crown Grill is the WheelHouse Bar, another Princess staple. It serves pub lunches daily in addition to a drink menu that include a variety of whiskey flights. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Regal Princess' buffet eatery is twice as large as those on most previous Princess ships -- a nod to growing demand for casual dining on cruise ships. It's split into two areas, the Horizon Court (shown here) and the Horizon Bistro. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Closer to the outdoor pool deck, the Horizon Bistro section of the buffet area offers quick grab-and-go items in addition to a hibachi grill, rotisseries, carving stations, a taqueria and salad stations. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Horizon Bistro also is home to The Pastry Shop, a dedicated space for fresh-made pastries, hot desserts and flambe. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Hand-washing stations are located at the entrance to the Horizon Bistro buffet area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The most spacious of the 1,780 cabins on the Regal Princess are its 36 suites, one of which is shown here. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Suites feature a bedroom separate from the living room as well as two bathrooms and a large balcony. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Suite bathrooms are large and offer full bathtubs as well as separate showers. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A suite bathtub. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A shower in a suite bathroom. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Suites have a secondary bathroom located just off the living room. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A suite balcony. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Among the most common of the Regal Princess' 1,780 cabins are its 358 Deluxe Balcony cabins -- a larger version of the ship's standard balcony cabin. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Deluxe Balcony cabins have desk areas with outlets and a built-in mini-bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Miniature refrigerators are a standard item in Regal Princess cabins. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Outlets in cabins aboard the Regal Princess allow for both American-style and European-style plugs. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Nightstands are located on each side of the bed in Deluxe Balcony cabins. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Deluxe Balcony cabin bathrooms are simple but functional with built-in sinks and corner shelving for toiletries. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Deluxe Balcony cabin bathrooms feature showers but no bathtubs. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Just off the bathroom, the closet area of a Deluxe Balcony cabin offers a large area for hanging clothes. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Closet areas in Deluxe Balcony cabins also offer shelf space and a small safe behind a tall vertical door. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Deluxe Balcony cabins have balconies with two chairs and a small table. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Regal Princess' Lotus Spa is located on Deck 5 of the ship, below the main theater and much lower than on most Princess ships. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A treatment room for two at the Regal Princess' Lotus Spa. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 17, the Regal Princess' fitness center is Princess' largest at sea, with a wide range of sports equipment overlooking the ocean. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A weight equipment area in the Regal Princess' fitness center. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A multi-purpose room in the fitness center used for spinning classes, aerobics and more. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen One deck above the fitness center, Princess Sports Central has an outdoor basketball court, table tennis area, shooting range, putting green and large jogging track. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A golf driving range is located on the Sports Deck. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Lawn Court on Deck 19 has a faux-grass putting green for golfers. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Ping pong tables are among the activities on the Sports Deck. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A jogging track wraps around the Regal Princess' top deck. Seven laps makes a mile. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Just outside the Horizon Bistro on the Regal Princess' main pool deck is Swirls, which serves free soft-serve ice cream with dipping sauces and sprinkles. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Cigar smokers have their own dedicated space on the Regal Princess called Churchill's. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Regal Princess offers a small library on Deck 7. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen An area of boutique shops is located on Deck 7 just off the Piazza, with a spiral staircase down to the ship's casino. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Among shops on Deck 7 near the Piazza is Essence, which sells perfumes and makeup. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Boutique shop Meridian Bay on Deck 7 sells jewelry. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located among the boutique shops is the Princess Art Gallery. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Contemporary art lines the walls of stairways throughout the Regal Princess. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Regal Princess' Shore Excursions desk. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Regal Princess' Passenger Services desk is just off the Atrium. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Teak lounge chairs with plush cushions line the Regal Princess' outdoor Promenade Deck. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Regal Princess has self-serve laundromats on cabin decks that contain washers, dryers, soap dispensers, irons and ironing boards.. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Regal Princess cabins have flat-screen TVs with a wide range of movies and television shows available at no extra charge. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Regal Princess' cabin hallways feature photos of cruise destinations taken by past Princess passengers. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A string quartet plays in the Regal Princess' Piazza. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Regal Princess docked in Kusadasi, Turkey in May 2014. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like this topic?
